intro: Meum heterophyllum, commonly known as the heterophyllous meum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It is characterized by its unique morphological variation, with different leaf shapes and sizes on its upper and lower stems. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Meum heterophyllum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
